cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper discusses Bayesian methods for learning both acausal and causal networks, which are commonly studied in the fields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also introduces new assumptions for learning causal networks, which may fall under the category of information theory (cs.IT). Additionally, the paper discusses the construction of priors, which may relate to the field of statistics (cs.DS). Finally, the paper does not seem to focus on a specific application area, which makes it less likely to belong to a more specialized sub-category.
